name: Into the Chasm - Chasm-003
descTitle: The Beast Falls, and Melusa Opens
tagline: in which living snow defends a white beast, the maze breaks, and the Ice Palace stirs
shortSummary: The party finishes the brutal fight in the black-stone chamber, kills the shaggy white beast, follows a new earthen tunnel out to the cliffside village of Melusa, and learns that an Ice Palace and its soldiers are watching—and building a bridge toward the village.
longSummary: The battle in the black-stone chamber escalates as “Living Snow” echoes harry the party and actively protect the shaggy white beast from mundane attacks, forcing the group to lean on Spirit Guardians, summoned creatures, and psionic damage to break through. When the beast finally falls, the wind stops and the chamber melts back into granite and earth, splitting open a tunnel that Kalima recognizes as the way forward. Crawling through permafrost, the party emerges onto a cliffside switchback overlooking floating rocks and an isolated Ice Palace, then slips into Melusa to shelter with Kalima’s family and question the village’s strange myths of endurance, fog, and sacrifice. Finnan’s Clairvoyance and Ekko’s scouting reveal activity within the palace and an ice bridge beginning to grow toward Melusa as soldiers search for a “trickster” spirit who taunted their master.

npcs.name: Kalima
npcs.notes: Terrified woman from Melusa who survives the beast fight by hiding behind illusion, then leads the party home and into her sister’s house.

npcs.name: Rala
npcs.notes: Jrain’s avian companion; used in combat to strike the Living Snow echoes.

npcs.name: Shaggy white beast
npcs.notes: The monster guarding the black-stone chamber; protected by Living Snow echoes and defeated after a prolonged fight.

npcs.name: Forquarion the Frostbinder
npcs.notes: Named as the beast’s master via Finnan’s ‘three true facts’; described as the Frostbinder.

npcs.name: Zeyfa
npcs.notes: Named as the one who lives in the Ice Palace; soldiers invoke the name while searching for a ‘trickster’ spirit.

npcs.name: Nura
npcs.notes: Kalima’s sister in Melusa; shelters the party and speaks cautiously about the village’s beliefs and taboos.

npcs.name: Khaled
npcs.notes: Nura’s husband; describes Melusa’s worldview of endurance and fog and is wary of outsiders, especially around children.

npcs.name: Samir
npcs.notes: Nura and Khalid’s baby; unusually quiet and treated as potentially vulnerable to ‘remembering too much’.

npcs.name: Yāsim
npcs.notes: Name overheard via Clairvoyance as soldiers coordinate search orders near the Ice Palace.

npcs.name: Zeyfa
npcs.notes: Figure tied to the labyrinth; villagers say their ancestors were brought here by Zeyfa and that night ends only with sacrifice.

npcs.name: Romil the Glacier King
npcs.notes: A famous kestavo name the villagers recognize; invoked in stories and prayer.

npcs.name: Besla
npcs.notes: A kestavo name the villagers recognize in stories.

npcs.name: Rabel
npcs.notes: A kestavo name mentioned among the villagers’ fragmentary stories.

places.name: Zeyfa's Labyrinth
places.notes: The shifting maze that traps the party; the black-stone chamber and the tunnel out are within it.

places.name: Black-stone chamber
places.notes: Combat site where the shaggy white beast and Living Snow echoes are defeated; changes as the beast dies.

places.name: Earthen tunnel
places.notes: A manhole-sized opening that forms as frost melts; the party crawls through permafrost to escape the chamber.

places.name: Great Chasm
places.notes: Seen from the cliffside switchback; floating rocks and the Ice Palace hang in the fog.

places.name: Ice Palace
places.notes: Floating palace not connected by bridges; scouted via summoned fey and Clairvoyance; soldiers begin forming an ice bridge toward Melusa.

places.name: Melusa
places.notes: Cliff-carved village on a ledge with a pond, river, goats, cattle, and a worldview defined by fog, endurance, and sacrifice.

places.name: Cliff gashes (five portals)
places.notes: Five jagged cuts in the cliff face showing different hostile ‘elsewheres’ (lightning, metal, colors, ash, and a mirrored chasm view).

places.name: Ice wolf statue
places.notes: A towering ice wolf statue standing guard near the gashes; villagers keep their distance.

places.name: Cattle rock
places.notes: Floating rock with a partially frozen pond and a herd of cattle; connected by rope bridge to the lush rock.

places.name: Lush rock
places.notes: Floating rock with trees, thick growth, and steam; produces food (including apples) brought to Melusa by rope bridge.

combats.name: Shaggy white beast and Living Snow echoes

treasure: Severed head of the shaggy white beast (trophy)
